title: Amazing Race's influencer couple Sid and Ash stole from NUNS
text:
They previously claimed their confidence would take them all the way to the end.

And The Amazing Race's self-described 'influencers' Sid Pierucci and Ash Ruscoe were quickly branded villains, during Monday night's premiere episode.

The Sydney-based couple had viewers outraged when they stole dumplings from nuns Judy and Therese during a challenge.

'You are definitely going to hell!' The Amazing Race Australia's self-described 'influencers' Sid and Ash (both pictured), have been branded the villains after they stole from NUNS

'Yes Sid, you are most definitely going to hell. Competition or not, you don't steal from a nun,' one angered viewer shared on Twitter.

'I don't actually believe in organised religion but who steals from a pair of nuns? What filthy trash,' another wrote.

'Protest against the influencers for stealing from the nuns. Should be disqualified,' posted one.

Online: Outraged viewers took to Twitter during Monday night's premiere episode, saying the act was 'despicable'. Others suggested Sid and Ash would later blame editing

Others suggested Sid, 26, and Ash, 30, would later blame their actions on editing.

'Just waiting for these influencers to complain about the editing when they literally stole from nuns,' one wrote.

During Monday night's episode, Sid and Ash found themselves having to make 50 perfectly-crafted dumplings at the same time as nuns Judy and Therese.

Task: A challenge saw Sid, 26, and Ash, 30, having to make 50 perfectly-crafted dumplings

Brazen act: The Sydney couple stole dumplings from nuns Judy and Therese (both pictured), while they went downstairs to fetch more pastry

When the nuns went downstairs to fetch more pastry, Ash brazenly asked Sid: 'Should we take some of their dumplings?'

Wasting no time, Sid took a few dumplings, as Ash looked on somewhat in shock.

'I'm going to hell after this,' Sid remarked, while Ash later laughed off their behaviour in a piece to camera.

In an interview with The Daily Telegraph earlier this month, Sid boasted: 'I have an insane level of self-confidence in the ability to get through any situation regardless of what life throws my way.'

Confident: Sid previously told The Daily Telegraph that the couple have the confidence to make it all the way to the end on The Amazing Race Australia

'Having built at such a young age a life where I get to call my own shots was always something I strived for from a young age,' he added.

Sid boasts over 13,000 followers on Instagram, while Ash has over 22,000 followers on her respective Instagram page.

Meanwhile, Ash claimed one of the biggest challenges the couple face is their mutual stubbornness, which would often lead to arguments.

The Amazing Race Australia continues Tuesday at 7.30pm on Channel Ten.
description: The Amazing Race Australia premiered on Monday night, and 'influencer' couple Sid and Ash were quickly branded the villains.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
